festival.introText:
Belladrum Tartan Heart Festival 2023

Belladrum Tartan Heart Festival is a firm favourite on the festival calendar, with a loyal following of fervent fans that return year on year. 

With fantastic music ranging across a variety of genres - indie, rock, Dance, Celtic, Celtic rock, blues, roots, singer-songwriter and many more - as well as a brilliant array of children's entertainment, street theatre, cabaret, cinema, alternative therapies and food and drink so is perfect for all of the family.   

One of the unique benefits of Bella is the scenery. The festival takes place in a beautiful Highland setting with terraced Italian gardens, mature trees, fields and parkland with the hills beyond.    

Belladrum Festival continues to excite and enthral with its mixture of natural beauty and raw excitement, and is certainly cementing itself as a hidden gem in the festival circuit.

FAQs can be found here: http://www.tartanheartfestival.co.uk/info/faqs/

faqs.question: When is Belladrum 2023?
faqs.answer: Belladrum Tartan Heart Festival returns to Belladrum Estate Thursday 27th July - Saturday 29th July 2023.

faqs.question: Does Belladrum have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: Yes Belladrum has various options for camping and campervans across the site.

faqs.question: How do I get to Belladrum?
faqs.answer:
By Car - It is recommended to arrive early to use the designated car parks, it can take between 5- 15 minutes to walk to your campsite. 

By Bus - Shuttle runs from Inverness Bus Station and regular bus services from Scottish Towns Transport are available. 

By Taxi - There are several local taxi firms to choose from. 

 

By Air - Inverness Airport is 45 minutes drive from Belladrum. It takes approximately 1.5 hours to fly from London.

faqs.question: How much are Belladrum tickets?
faqs.answer: Tickets start from £88 plus booking fee for Saturday Adult Tickets, 3 Day Weekend Tickets start from £188 plus booking fee.

faqs.question: Is there disabled access at Belladrum?
faqs.answer:
BELLADRUM 2023 ACCESS SCHEME

 

PERSONAL ASSISTANT TICKETS

A Personal Assistant ticket (also known as a carer’s ticket) is offered free of charge when somebody with a disability requires a carer to be in attendance with them. Please note we have a fixed allocation of personal assistant tickets which are allocated on a first come first serve basis.

 

To be eligible, please provide a copy of one of the following pieces of documentation listed below.

> Front page of DLA / PIP (no specific rate)

> Front page of Attendance Allowance letter (no specific rate)

> Evidence that registered severely sight impaired (blind)

> Credability's Access Card

 

IF YOU ARE NOT A BLUE BADGE HOLDER:

You should book the tickets you require (not including the Personal Assistant ticket) through our tickets page.

For your free Personal Assistant Ticket, you should then apply to Belladrum with your documentation along with your 16-digit order reference number by emailing admin@tartanheartfestival.co.uk

 

MOBILITY CAMPING AND PARKING AREA

Blue Badge campers (higher rate mobility) can camp and/or park in the Mobility Camping & Parking Area. Persons without mobility issues should park in the appropriate area for where they want to camp (quiet/family/general)

 

IF YOU ARE A BLUE BADGE HOLDER (higher rate mobility):

You should book the tickets you require (not including any Live-In Vehicle or Personal Assistant tickets required) through our tickets page. For your free Personal Assistant Ticket and access to the Mobility Camping & Parking Area for your party you should then apply to Belladrum by emailing admin@tartanheartfestival.co.uk. (Parties restricted to 4 persons & 1 car per application).

Please supply evidence of being a Blue Badge holder (higher rate mobility), along with your 16-digit order reference number & the number of Mobility Area passes required. Assuming you qualify, we will issue you with your Mobility Camping Area passes and your Mobility Area Vehicle pass.

 

 

MOBILITY CAMPERVAN/CARAVAN AREA

The Mobility Campervan/Caravan Area is situated in an area closest to the main arena. You need to have tickets to this area and to have qualified for these as a blue badge holder. To get a campervan/caravan ticket for the Mobility Campervan/Caravan Area and an electrical hook-up if you require one, you should apply for these through Belladrum by emailing admin@tartanheartfestival.co.uk. (Do not buy these tickets through the normal tickets page.)

Please supply evidence of being a Blue Badge holder (higher rate mobility), along with your 16-digit order reference number & the number of Mobility Area Campervan Passes / Electric Hook Up Add Ons required.

faqs.question: Where is Belladrum?
faqs.answer: Belladrum is located on the Belladrum Estate, By Beauly, Inverness in the Highlands of Scotland. The postcode is IV4 7BA.

faqs.question: Where can I leave my car?
What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

 

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Where do I park as a blue badge (higher rate mobility) day visitor?
faqs.answer: If you have a Mobility Area pass and Mobility Area Vehicle pass, you can day park in the Mobility Parking & Camping area.

faqs.question: Does Belladrum have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Belladrum is a family festival, all ages welcome. You may be asked to show photo ID.

faqs.question: Are all areas of the festival accessible by wheelchair?
faqs.answer: Yes, and there are special viewing areas in many of the arenas; however, this is an outdoor event and conditions could become muddy and slippery.

faqs.question: What ID is accepted?
faqs.answer: The festival accepts Passports, Driving Licences and any other photo ID with a PASS logo.

faqs.question: Can I apply for my Personal Assistant ticket or Mobility Area pass later in the year?
faqs.answer: There is a limit for personal assistant tickets and a limit on mobility camping and parking capacity. Once these are reached we cannot accept any further applications.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into Belladrum?
faqs.answer: You are allowed to bring food and drink to the campsite however you are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into the festival site. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival, serving up organic, vegetarian and vegan options.

faqs.question: Can I leave and re-enter?
faqs.answer: Yes, until midnight. After midnight the gates won't re-open until 8am.

faqs.question: What are the set times?
faqs.answer: The exact timings are confirmed much closer to the festival. Once confirmed they will be available within the free programme and posted up by each stage.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Belladrum Tartan Heart Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: The Belladrum Tartan Heart at the top of the Garden Stage stairs was a big miss. Something needs to be done to reduce queues at the bars â¦more staff perhaps mores bars or bring back the drinks token system to speed things up.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Belladrum Tartan Heart Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: My one disappointment over the weekend was lack of internet service.  This was not an issue in 2019 with my same provider

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Belladrum Tartan Heart Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Fabulous event , well run . Good fun and totally loved the Vegan Quarter !

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Belladrum Tartan Heart Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Brilliant weekend, first time camping & I'd definitely do it again.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Belladrum Tartan Heart Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body:
Totally loved our experience at our first ever music festival. 
We stayed in Pitch Village, staff were all brilliant. The only thing I would say was disappointed that the toilets were not serviced and cleaned on the last morning. But other than that it was amazing experience. Will be booking for next year!

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Belladrum Tartan Heart Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: First timer to Belladrum- in fact any music festival - and will definitely be back! Amazing experience! Thank you team Belladrum.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Belladrum Tartan Heart Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Great selection of music, beautiful setting

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Belladrum Tartan Heart Festival 2019
reviewsDisplayFour.body: What an amazing venue well organised caters for various tvpes of music very family friendly awesome time had  lots to do plenty camping plenty parking awsome
